Keep in mind for the next ubisoft game:

"To clear the minds of the individuals who think: "Game x was
done fast and this one taking ages" etc.  The way the Ubisoft
DRM works, makes it so that every game is like a brand new
challenge. What it does do, is offload certain parts of the
game to a server, game then requests those things at runtime.
These parts can be anything that the developer wants."

"Open regedit, search for ?AlternateVerticalSyncThreshold?. Unless you have multiple Ubi games installed, it should immediately give you PoP?s registry key. It should look something like Software->Ubisoft->Prince of Persia ? The Forgotten Sands->1.000000000->Engine

Right-click the folder called 1.000000000 and rename it to 1.0."

FOR THOSE HAVING THE PROBLEM OF THE PRISON GATE
1)if the prison door is not opening nw den jst backup ur saved game(just copy it sumwhere in ur pc) the saved games are located here 
C:\Users\XXXX\AppData\Local\storage\SKIDROW

2)uninstall the game and reinstall the game

3)now copy all the files including 
ubiorbitapi_r2.dll
skidrow.ini
SKIDROW.exe
Prince of Persia.exe
gu.exe
in the game directory

4)run the game and select new game,
and select the easy difficulty.......normal wont work....
(IMP NOTE-dont select normal first n den change it before the prison gate.....just select easy difficulty and play it )

5)hope it works................i was able to open the prison gate in the first run........

I found this for the 3 summoners and it helped me pass the door.The person that helped me said
"GUYS!
I found a solution for 3 summoners bug!!!
Download the h4Ă0r trainer named:
?Prince_of_Persia_The_Forgotten_Sands_v1.0_+_6_Trainer?
1. Start it
2. Start the game and start playing
3. Play the game and get to the closed door with no enemies left
4. Stand next to the door.
5. Enable the trainer with ?Insert? button, and save your position with ?NUMPAD6?
6. From the menu load the last checkpoint
7. Right when the animation starts with the 3 summoners load your position with ?NUMPAD7?

This did the trick for me and Im through :D

Nice, the .dll file I put into my already existing Ubisoft Launcher folder overwrote my ACII save.

I could have known it would somehow affect my ACII (same file for 2 games, clever clever Ubisoft), probably didn't even need to replace it in the first place since my ACII is a cracked version as well.

SO JUST A WARNING! If you have ACII (or any other Ubisoft game that makes use of that .dll) don't blindly overwrite it with this one or you may very well lose savegames. >.

does anyone have any saved games from somewhere closer to the beginnging...I am somewhere in the fortress courtyard, stuck at this point according to the walkthrough:


 -Located to the right of the door with the three sand statues is a button; do a wall run up the wall to touch it. This will trigger the wall that it is built in to move forward. Once it moves as far forward as it can, perform another wall run before quickly jumping across to the other wall and doing a wall run up this wall to get to the top.

-Perform a wall run on the right side of the wall before jumping out to the wood column on your left.

-Rotate and jump to the next column before jumping to the wood plank. Jump from here towards the ledge in front of you, remembering to do a wall run as soon as you hit it to pull yourself up.

-Perform a wall run against the wall and then jump out to the golden lever on your right. Swing and jump across several poles before landing on the other side.

-Go through the entryway and wait for swinging beam of spikes to swing all the way back, giving you just enough clearance to roll under it.
